content: a simple and lacy crescent that is suitable to show off the beautiful colors in gradient yarns pick a colorful gradient cake to make a statement or a more neutral colorway to wear it with most things in your wardrobe use a strand of lacy mohair to turn a summer yarn into a winter-ready yarn > this pattern is available as pay what you can > use one of the following coupons to pay 80% 60% or 40% of the listed price > > pattern80 >pattern60 >pattern40 the right handed video shows the first 7 row and the two row of edging 1 left handed video is also available 2 **skill level** beginner you need to know how to make double_crochet stitches chains popcorn stitches and slip stitches you can follow along with the video tutorial and then continue working off pattern if you want to **finished size** if you use the recommended yarn you will get a shawl that is about 250 cm or 98″ in length and 60 cm or 24″ in width **notions** you will need a cake of gradient yarn approximately 800 meters or 200 grams of size 2 yarn and companion lace-weight mohair yarn 800 meters actual weight in grams may vary from one brand to another you will work with these held together alternatively you can choose any fluffy aran or weight 4 yarn also about 800 grams choose an airy yarn for the best results you ll also need a 6 mm hook and a tapestry needle for weaving in the ends 1 https //youtu be/l78q5toz2do 2 https //youtu be/ujh7mbdycho
